title: Petition: Do not remove LGBT content from the Relationships Education curriculum

last_post.content:
I am going to keep posting about this until we get to 100,000 signatures.

You are now getting bored of seeing these posts, please don't give up, we can do this.

As I write there are 88,402 signatures. The linear trend line of signatures from Tuesday 31 January gives an equation of
y = 925.5x + 82681.
That means the date for hitting 100,000 votes has drifted out by two more days to Friday 17 February. I know we can do better than this. The last we thing we want is the petition to remove LGBT content from the curriculum to be debated and our opinion not to be heard.

Please sign if you are in the UK and please boost if you are not.

May I take this opportunity to thank each and everyone of the 1,180 people that have boosted this post so far. ❤️ 💖

Petition: Do not remove LGBT content from the Relationships Education curriculum

https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/631529

title: A New Drug Switched Off My Appetite. What’s Left?

last_post.content:
In my most recent column for WIRED I describe my experience with Mounjaro, a new drug for type 2 diabetics that deeply manipulates satiety, with a side effect of radical weight loss.

Fat is a vast subject involving economics, agriculture, race, gender, sexuality, cultural norms, psychology, biology, even climate. In contrast I'm relating an individual, fragmentary experience, in a state of confusion, at a moment of vulnerability. I'm sure it will go great.

https://www.wired.com/story/new-drug-switched-off-appetite-mounjaro/

title: The Cement Mixer Space Capsule of Winganon

last_post.content:
A cement truck crashed near Winganon, Oklahoma in the 1950s and the mixer was too heavy to move. It’s still there; locals have painted it to look like an abandoned NASA
capsule.

title: Top climate scientists are sceptical that nations will rein in global warming

last_post.content:
When leading climate scientists are asked anonymously or off-the-record what they actually expect we will have to endure in the decades ahead, you'll find they are not very optimistic.

In 2021, the journal Nature conducted an anonymous survey of IPCC authors and received responses from 92 scientists. Their answers suggest strong skepticism that governments will significantly slow the pace of global heating, despite all those fancy promises we've heard ("blah-blah-blah").

Six in ten of the survey respondents expect the world to warm by at least 3°C by the end of the century. Some think 4°C or even 5°C is where we're headed. Fewer than 5% of these scientists believe we will stay under 1.5°C, which is the optimistic — and totally unrealistic — outcome that politicians and the major media want you to swallow.

#ClimateCrisis

https://www.nature.com/articles/d41586-021-02990-w

In one Walpurgis Night, the postman of Wittmar waited for his usual delivery, but it had not arrived. Thus, he went out on the road to see if it was coming.

However, there was a crossroads in front of the post station. As soon as he had stepped on it, his nose was twisted around until it was on the back of his head.

He died out of fright.

#Germany #folktale #folklore

Improvements to case_when , in particular how default options are handled - a welcome change.

New:
case_match - very good innovation, I like this idea a lot.

consecutive_id - another improvement inspired by data.table (the rleid function - which I've been using for several years in all sorts of scenarios) - I've always found rleid to be very handy and though you can (kind of) hack this with row_number and grouping, it'll be good to be able to use this directly

title: Myspace loses all content uploaded before 2016

last_post.content:
Reminder that whatever you store on an internet site will one day vanish, even if it's stored on the largest and richest site in the world:

"Myspace, the once mighty social network, has lost every single piece of content uploaded to its site before 2016, including millions of songs, photos and videos with no other home on the internet."

https://www.theguardian.com/technology/2019/mar/18/myspace-loses-all-content-uploaded-before-2016

Please don't rely on internet services to exist forever, they will all disappear eventually.

Try to store copies of important stuff offline if you can. Music, video, photos etc can all be stored locally.
